description: On the morning of January 1, 2030, Maria Gonzalez started experiencing severe symptoms of Norovirus, including vomiting, diarrhea, and stomach cramps. Despite her discomfort, she managed to complete her shift at the hospital before heading home to rest.

A1_ppt_sick/ill_one.name: Maria Gonzalez
A1_ppt_sick/ill_one.desc: Maria Gonzalez is a 32-year-old nurse working at a busy hospital in the heart of the city. She is dedicated to her profession and often works long hours, which leaves her little time for social activities. However, she enjoys attending community events and gatherings whenever she can.

A2_cau_cause_or_disease.name: Norovirus
A2_cau_cause_or_disease.desc: Norovirus is a highly contagious virus that causes gastroenteritis, leading to symptoms such as vomiting, diarrhea, and stomach cramps. It is known for its rapid spread in crowded environments like urban areas, schools, and hospitals. The virus is transmitted through contaminated water and body fluids, making it a common cause of outbreaks in densely populated regions.

AM_loc.name: Riverside District
AM_loc.desc: Riverside District is a densely populated urban neighborhood known for its vibrant community life and bustling markets. It is situated along the banks of a major river, which serves as a primary water source for the residents.

description: Maria Gonzalez, a dedicated nurse, and Liam O'Brien, a popular bus driver, have both contracted Norovirus, a highly contagious virus causing gastroenteritis. The virus, known for its rapid spread in crowded environments, has begun to infect people in the densely populated urban area where they both work.

A1-gol_thing_becoming_infected.name: Maria Gonzalez
A1-gol_thing_becoming_infected.desc: Maria Gonzalez is a 32-year-old nurse working at a busy hospital in the heart of the city. She is dedicated to her profession and often works long hours, which leaves her little time for social activities. However, she enjoys attending community events and gatherings whenever she can.

A2-ppt_infectant.name: Liam O'Brien
A2-ppt_infectant.desc: Liam O'Brien is a 50-year-old bus driver who operates one of the busiest routes in the Riverside District. Known for his friendly demeanor and punctuality, Liam interacts with hundreds of passengers daily, unknowingly becoming a carrier of the Norovirus.

A0_pag_agent_causer_of_infection.name: Norovirus

The virus is transmitted through contaminated water and body fluids, making it a common cause of outbreaks in densely populated regions.

description: Feeling increasingly unwell, Maria Gonzalez decided to contact her health provider, Dr. Samuel Patel, for advice on her symptoms. She reached out to him at around 3PM, shortly after her shift ended.

A2_com_co_agent_other_communicators.name: Dr. Samuel Patel
A2_com_co_agent_other_communicators.desc: Dr. Samuel Patel is a 45-year-old infectious disease specialist working at the same hospital as Maria Gonzalez. He is known for his calm demeanor and methodical approach to diagnosing and treating infectious diseases. Dr. Patel has a keen interest in epidemiology and often collaborates with public health officials to manage outbreaks.

description: Feeling progressively worse, Maria Gonzalez decided to go to the hospital for a check-up. She left her apartment at 5PM and arrived at the hospital around 5:30PM.

description: At 9AM, the Urban Infectious Disease Research Center (UIDRC) detected the full scale of the Norovirus outbreak in the city. The center identified a significant increase in the number of cases reported in the past few days, with Maria Gonzalez being one of the patients.

It is dedicated to studying and managing infectious diseases in urban environments. The center collaborates closely with local hospitals, universities, and public health officials to monitor disease outbreaks and develop effective strategies for disease control and prevention.

A1_ppt_theme_item_being_labelled.name: Carlos Rodriguez
A1_ppt_theme_item_being_labelled.desc: Carlos Rodriguez is a 38-year-old food vendor who operates a popular food cart in the Riverside District. He is known for his refreshing fruit juices and smoothies, which he prepares using water from the local river. Carlos is a friendly and sociable individual, often engaging in conversations with his many customers throughout the day.

description: By 4PM, Dr. Samuel Patel and his team, in collaboration with local health officials, initiated a quarantine protocol for the exposed individuals in the Riverside District. They identified and isolated around 200 people who had direct or indirect contact with Carlos Rodriguez, the local food vendor potentially exposed to the Norovirus.

A1_ppt_thing.name: Exposed Individuals
A1_ppt_thing.desc: Exposed Individuals refers to the large group of people in the Riverside District who have potentially come into contact with the Norovirus, either through contaminated water or body fluids. These individuals may not yet show symptoms but are at risk of developing the disease and spreading it to others. They are a key focus of the public health response to the outbreak.

A2_gol_quarrantined_from_whom.desc: Riverside District Residents refers to the diverse community of people living in the Riverside District, a bustling urban neighborhood. These individuals come from various backgrounds and occupations, contributing to the vibrant community life. Amidst the Norovirus outbreak, they are at high risk of exposure due to the district's dense population and the virus's mode of transmission.
